newsitem.title: JAPAN: Next G7 summit may discuss global finance - Japan PM.
newsitem.headline: Next G7 summit may discuss global finance - Japan PM.

text.p: Global financial systems are likely to be one of the major topics to be discussed at the next annual summit meeting of the Group of Seven (G7) industrialised nations, Prime Minister Ryutaro Hashimoto was quoted as saying on Wednesday.

In a breakfast meeting with Japanese business executives, Hashimoto also said an increasing number of G7 leaders are in favour of an idea in which only leaders attend the G7 summit, according to a company executive who attended the meeting.
Annual G7 meetings in the past have also been attended by foreign and finance ministers.
The next meeting is due to be held in Denver, Colorado, in June 1997. The G7 groups Britain, Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan and the United States.
The executive said Hashimoto did not elaborate on the subject of global financial systems.
